content.question: Let <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant that is bounded by the polar curve <math alttext="r equals, the square root of, 6 times, the sine of, open parenthesis, 3 times theta, close parenthesis, end root" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo>⁡</mo> <mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>θ</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </math>, as shown in the figure above. What is the area of <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.8: (BC ONLY) Find the Area of a Polar Region or the Area Bounded by a Single Polar Curve

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
